response.overview: Shortly after moving from Hong Kong to Edinburgh and settling into his student flat, filmmaker Freddie Chan discovers a clash among locals and overseas students over the massive housing shortage in Edinburgh. Developers are converting empty lots and unused old buildings into new housing stocks for international students rather than the locals. Through an empathetic and personal documentary lens, Chan befriends 91-year-old Harry, a long-time resident and community councillor, and follows a group of grassroots housing advocates in order to understand the clash and todayâ€™s global housing crisis.
response.title: The Dispute
